description: '''Hardcore hip-hop''' (also known as '''hardcore rap''') is a subgenre of [[Hip-hop|hip hop music]] that developed through the [[East Coast hip-hop|East Coast hip hop]] scene in the 1980s. Pioneered by such artists as [[Run-DMC]], [[Schoolly D]], [[Boogie Down Productions]] and [[Public Enemy]], it is generally characterized by [[anger]], [[aggression]] and [[confrontation]].
